sentences: Guy Rupert Berryman (born 12 April 1978) is a Scottish musician, songwriter, producer and businessman best known as the bassist of rock band Coldplay and electronic supergroup Apparatjik.
They signed with Parlophone in early 1999 and found global fame through Parachutes (2000) and subsequent records.
They signed with Parlophone in early 1999 and found global fame through Parachutes (2000) and subsequent records.
The band have sold over 100 million albums worldwide, making them the most successful group of the 21st century.
He dropped out of his architecture degree after one year to focus on playing bass with Coldplay.
In 2019, Berryman began publishing The Road Rat magazine, which celebrates classic automobiles, he runs it from his garage and also works on the creative direction.
In December 2020, he launched a function-focused menswear brand called "Applied Art Forms".
Over time I realised there were still gaps in my wardrobe, because I wanted clothing that was suited to the way we live now, with every design element considered and honed into a perfect garment.”

sentences: Apparatjik has made their first live performance at the eleventh edition of club transmediale, an annual festival in Berlin, which took place between 28 January and 7 February 2010.

In 2004, Berryman married Joanna Briston, his childhood sweetheart, in a low-key ceremony in the City of Westminster.
The couple have one daughter, Nico, born 17 September 2006.
